Description: Gold finger-ring; hoop in the form of two figures of Atys in high relief, one on either side, resting upon three acanthus leaves; hinged behind the heads of Atys is an oval setting rising in the form of receding steps; it contains a convex green glass paste(?).
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (721)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
